The Dusseldorf-based charity Dusseldorf Art Foundation (DAF) has appointed Solveig Hundman as its new chief executive officer. Hundman will be based in the German city from October 10–October 29 and will assume his post from Mehring Walter, who retired in March after eleven years at the institution. Hundman succeeds Stefan Sarr as CEO of the foundation after he spent eight months as the director of the Kunsthalle Basel, where he led the development of the Düsseldorf–based nonprofit project NDR. In his new role, he will be responsible for increasing the budget of the foundation and providing it with additional support.�
